lines.line: Sorry, but you need to be a better hunter before we can help you out.
Oh, you're a new face around here, aren't you?
I am indeed. Just exploring the savannah.
Well, I'm Apatura. Let me welcome you to our small corner of Varlamore.
What do you do here?
We're mostly here to keep an eye on the local animal populations, and provide animal parts to the city.
As for me personally, I'm the current master of this guild.
Current master?
A hunter's work is dangerous. We tend to go through members faster than other guilds.
That said, I'm usually too busy with politics and paperwork to go out hunting.
Could I hunt with the guild?
Absolutely! There's always more work to be done.
Can I help you with anything?
I'm not sure if you have the time or the patience, iknami, but a little birdy told me that our esteemed scribe Verity may require some assistance.
What sort of assistance?
If I had to guess, she needs someone to find something for her.
She's a wonderful scribe, but can lose some strange things here and there.
Great! Point me in her direction and I'll get cracking!
She's behind the bar in the Burrow. Just look for the stressed woman trying to wrangle a bunch of barely-bathed hunters.
I'm not sure I have the time for that right now.
Tetamo... Well, hopefully it's not too important.
I'd better be off.
Nilsal, hunter.
Nilsal, Apatura.
Are you free to talk about my quest?
Absolutely. Have you spoken to Verity yet?
No, not quite yet.
If you're having a hard time finding her, she's behind the bar in the Burrow.
Oh, hello there newcomer. I'm Guild Scribe Verity. Do you need me to explain the work we do here?
Yes please.
So it's nice and simple. Just chat to any of the hunters in here to help them out.
Reports?
Indeed. There are all sorts of interesting creatures to hunt out there.
If you do decide to take a job from any of the hunters, they'll tell you what type of creature they're looking into.
Once you've caught it, bring some proof back to the hunter that sent you out.
I see. Thanks for the information.
Now, what else can I do for you.
Well actually, I heard there might be something I could help you with?
You'll have to be slightly more specific. There's always something that needs doing down here!
Something a little birdy may have told Apatura?
Tetamo... Pitri needs to stop twittering with the birds. Yes, Gilman and I are concerned about Fox.
He left quietly in the night, but we have no record of what he was doing.
Do you normally keep track of the hunters here?
We try to, but it's like herding cats! We at least like to keep an eye on what they're hunting.
Could anyone else have put Fox onto a hunt?
If anyone did, it would've been Wolf. She's always getting Fox into some kind of trouble.
I'll follow up with her then.
Have you spoken to Wolf yet?
Not yet. I'll have a chat to her now.
Absolutely. So was our little birdy right about Verity needing a hand?
They were... It wasn't an actual bird was it?
Of course not. Only Pitri talks to the birds.
So, here to ask me what trouble I've gotten Fox into, are you?
That's not quite how I'd word it... but how did you know?
I've honed my instincts over the years.
Well, that and the fact you had that whole conversation within earshot.
Right... So did you send Fox out to do something?
Sort of. He's on some very unofficial business for me.
How unofficial?
If I told you... I'd have to kill you!
Your face! Don't worry, I'm just pulling your leg.
I asked him to look into making some repairs to Kiko's bed.
It's been getting tatty lately. I'm guessing he didn't end up having the materials needed.
Well then I guess the first step is to work out what he went to get.
Could I take a look at Kiko's bed?
You're welcome to try, but you'll need to convince Kiko to let you.
He's just by the table there.
Any advice for convincing him?
He's very easy to distract. We have a little fake mouse we use sometimes.
Could I borrow it when I have a free hand to take it?
Sure thing.
Could I borrow it to have a go at distracting him?
Absolutely!
Have you checked Kiko's bed yet? It's just to the side of this table.
Not yet. Could I grab that mouse to distract him with?
Absolutely.
Not yet. I'll get to it now.
Not yet. Do you happen to have that mouse to distract him with?
I already gave it to you. If you've lost it, you'll need to get another for yourself.
Can you scratch my belly next? It's perfectly safe.
Are you not going to wind it up first? Come on now, put some effort in.
Do you mind? I'm trying to sleep here.
Here you go, little guy.
A mouse? Fantastic!
Something attacked me in the dark... I can't move much...
Can I help you? Maybe patch you up?
That would be much appreciated! There should be a couple of plants around to make a poultice...
There should be a couple of plants around to make a... make a...
Stay with me, Fox! Where are these plants?
It's a bit fuzzy... I've lost a lot of blood! One should be around here...
...the other may be near the oasis... with the capybabas... haha, capybaras...
And what am I making with them?
A poultice! And hold it together with the tail from an embertailed jerboa.
Plants. Tail. Poultice. On it.
Don't forget... your traps for the jerboa... they're boxy...
How's that poul... pool... poultice... Did you find the plants?
I think I've got them both.
It doesn't look like you do... Who's the one with the head wound again?
Where can I find them?
Absolutely. How's it going, iknami?
We're getting there. I should have everything sorted very soon.
Fox has been injured out in the savannah!
Well, that is impressive. How has he managed that?
He said he was attacked by an unknown assailant.
Well as you're not offering your condolences, I can only assume he's survived?
He should be fine once I help him make a poultice for the wound.
Excellent. A final question - was his hand injured?
No?
Wonderful! Then I look forward to reading his report.
I've found Fox. He's been injured by something out in the savannah.
Oh no... I should've offered to go with him.
It's never sensible to be out after dark alone...
I'm going to do what I can to make sure he's okay.
Well thanks for checking in at least.
He's still breathing and that's all Fox needs to come out on top.
Any updates on Fox?
He's been injured out in the savannah, but I'll do my best to make sure he makes it back.
Tetamo! Only he could get injured on an errand for a cat!
I thought a little detour wouldn't hurt. I'd caught a glimpse of the most stunning pelt ever seen!
As I was tracking it, I was attacked and knocked out. When I came to, it was gone.
Gone?
Without a trace, as well as most of my hunting equipment.
Do you think someone attacked you for it, or was it just an opportunist looting you?
I was unconscious.
Right, of course.
You've already done me a huge favour, but I don't suppose I could ask for one more small one?
I suppose I could. Especially if it goes towards repairing that cat's bed.
Well it's your lucky day! Make some room and I'll give you the sample.
Well it's your lucky day! Take this sample to a woman called Atza in Outer Fortis.
Where in the outskirts can I find her? And... what exactly do we need, again?
She lives by the south western gate of the city.
She'll be able to give us the matching fur to repair the cat's bed with.
Perfect! Here you go!
Any success with Atza yet?
Not quite.
If you're struggling to find her, she's in Outer Fortis, near the south western gate.
I appear to have lost the sample you gave me...
Luckily, I always come prepared. Here's a spare.
Ah. It seems I don't have room for it.
Well I'm not going anywhere. Let me know when you do have room.
I don't suppose you've got another sample of Kiko's bed for me to take to Atza?
Fortunately for you, I'm always prepared...
And our thief clearly didn't care for fine fur samples.
That's convenient! Usually I'm the one that's always ready for these situations.
Hello again. I've given Atza the fur sample.
Did she give you the matching material?
Not yet. I should check back in with her.
Hi there. You must be Atza. I heard you're the person to talk to about getting some material to match a sample?
I might be. Depends who's asking... and what you're looking for, of course.
Your friend Fox was going to bring this sample to you, but he's been a little... waylaid.
Well, this wouldn't be the first time! Let's take a look.
I don't seem to have it with me.
You'll have to go back to Fox and grab it then.
Here you go.
Good, good. Luckily for you, I recognise this fur.
I do have a bit left, but I'll have to dig it out.
Shall I just wait here then?
Oh... Fox usually helps me with my chores when he visits.
That's funny. He didn't mention that to me.
That's alright, I'm sure a capable adventurer like you will manage fine.
Fox was going to assemble some equipment for me. You can manage that, can't you?
I suppose so. Where do I start?
It's all in that pile on the floor there. You can work it out, I'm sure.
Now, luckily for you, I recognise this fur.
Don't forget, I need a hand setting up that equipment on the floor!
Don't worry, I'm on it.
So anyway, how did you come to be doing this for Fox?
Well, he actually got attacked on his way over here.
Shouldn't you be helping him heal up?
Oh he'll be alright. He was on the mend when I left him.
All done!
Oh, that's looking much better.
Now that's done, did you manage to find the material?
Yes, I have it here.
Thanks for your help today. I hope that fur works for your project.
Yes, but you don't have enough room for it! Come back when you have space.
Could I get a replacement for that fur? I managed to lose it.
You can, for now. I don't have an unlimited supply though, be careful.
Ah, you don't have space for that.
You should take that material back to Fox.
Hello again. I got the fur from Atza. She's certainly... something.
She didn't make you do odd jobs for her, did she?
How did you know?
She does it every time I visit!
Now, I'll need you to take this report back to Verity.
But it looks like you don't have space for it at the moment.
Anyway, now that's that, would you mind letting Wolf and Verity know I'm okay?
Oh, and can you take my report back to the guild?
Please apologise to Verity for the condition it's in.
Oh, and of course, don't forget to use that fur along with another embertailed jerboa tail to fix Kiko's bed!
Want me to save the world while I'm at it?
No need! You've already saved my world by making Kiko happy.
Hello there. Have you taken that report back to Verity yet?
Not yet. I still need to get around to it.
I've lost your report.
Well, that's just the adventuring way! If something isn't tied down, I'll grab it...
How is it you've lost the report and yet you somehow don't have space?
You're lucky I don't have anywhere else to be.
I'll write you another one. Just a moment...
Is that Fox's report? Thanks for bringing that back to us.
How was he?
He's injured, but he's on the mend.
I expect he'll be back in here soon enough.
Good to hear. Once you're done with the cat's bed, you might want to check in with Guildmaster Apatura.
Thanks for all your help. Once you're done with the cat's bed, you might want to check in with Guildmaster Apatura.
I'll go and speak to her now.
Thanks for all your help. Have you checked in with the Guildmaster?
How's the Fox situation?
Just about sorted. He'll be back here very soon.
Thank you, hunter.
He's doing well. He's got me doing a few things for him whilst he recuperates.
Ha! Now that's the Fox I know.
I'll have to give him some odd jobs once he's back to make up.
Looks like the Fox situation is all sorted.
Thank you, hunter. I'm not sure I could have forgiven myself if something terrible had happened to him.
Well as much as I resent the trickery used, this bed is much comfier now.
Everything's all wrapped up!
Kuani! So what was so important for our darling Kiko?
...that poor Fox risked life and limb?
So, basically Wolf sent Fox to get fur to fix Kiko's bed, but he actually needed to talk to Atza...
...and Atza needed me to...
Actually... I think I'll just read the report.

characters.name: Guildmaster Apatura
characters.description: Middle-aged female, warm Mediterranean-influenced accent, authoritative yet approachable tone. An experienced guild leader who manages hunters with professionalism and dry wit, often too busy with paperwork to hunt herself.

characters.name: Guild Scribe Verity
characters.description: Adult female, British accent, busy and slightly exasperated tone. An organized but overwhelmed scribe who manages records for unruly hunters, often comparing her job to herding cats.

characters.name: Guild Hunter Wolf (Master)
characters.description: Mature female, confident British accent, playful and teasing tone with underlying wisdom. A senior hunter who enjoys making jokes about killing people but genuinely cares for her fellow guild members.

characters.name: Guild Hunter Fox
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, energetic but currently weakened and delirious from injury. A resourceful hunter prone to getting distracted by interesting pelts, always prepared with backup supplies.

characters.name: Guild Hunter Kiko
characters.description: Male cat, high-pitched squeaky voice, demanding and pampered tone. A round grey feline guild member who enjoys belly scratches, mice toys, and comfortable beds.

characters.name: Atza
characters.description: Adult female, Mediterranean accent, shrewd and transactional tone. A skilled fabric and fur specialist in Outer Fortis who always finds ways to get visitors to do chores in exchange for her services.
